result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle D Ortiz

records.addlTxt: order of commitment for treatment distributed electronically

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
2:26PM Defendant Kyle D Ortiz in court, in custody.  Attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve in court for Kyle D Ortiz.  Attorney Hector Al-Homsi Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
IN CUSTODY
Re: Competency report and renewed motion for involuntary medication. Court will not be hearing the motion for involuntary medication today. 
Court gives warnings to all parties regarding speaking out of turn.  Defn removed from the courtroom at 2:32pm. Court makes record regarding defn's removal from court and waiver of right to be at the hearing.
Statement by Atty Ver Hoeve regarding defendant's agreement with the competency report. Defense takes no position on the competency and defendant will stand mute. Response by ADA Al-Homsi. 
K.G.B duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by State. Report dated 10/5/22 marked as exhibit 1 and rec'd. Cross exam by Defense. Witness excused. 
Argument by ADA Al-Homsi. Argument by Atty Ver Hoeve. Court makes ruling and finds defn not competent. Court will sign orders.
State requests 20 day extension on medication petition.  Court grants motion for extension. Hearing set for 11/15/22
for medication order from DHS
medication order request
Competency hearing on November 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Competency hearing on October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:05AM Court reporter Claire Stein. Defendant Kyle D Ortiz  in person, in custody.  Attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve in court for Kyle D Ortiz.  Attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. In court for competency hearing. Attorney Ver Hoeve states his client is contesting the competency report and the request for involuntary medication. State requests to reschedule hearing as the Dr is not able to attend today for testimony. Court addresses any time limits to holding a competency hearing and it appears the deadline for holding the hearing is 10/25. Atty VerHoeve would object to waiving time limits for holding the hearing on the motion. Court reschedules the competency hearing.
Competency hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Competency hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Kyle D Ortiz appeared by video.  ADA Trisha Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court speaks to DE's right to an attorney. Atty. Simmons responds, states DE should have one appointed for him regardless due to competency. Court attempts to have DE participate in hearing unsuccessfully; to have SPD appointment made for DE. Court sets competency hearing for 10-24-22 at 10:30am.

3:46 PM Defendant Kyle D Ortiz in court, in custody via Zoom.  Attorney Laura Breun in court for Kyle D Ortiz.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant declined to meaningfully participate in proceedings. The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and  ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION  pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14.  The Dept of Health & Family Services shall examine the defendant's mental competency to proceed. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Competency hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
